metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3551 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the PKI-server, where the spkispawn command, when run in debug mode, stores admin credentials in the installation log file. This flaw allows a local attacker to retrieve the file to obtain the admin password and gain admin privileges to the Dogtag CA manager. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3551` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dogtag-pki - 11.0.3-4
dogtag-pki-console-theme - 11.0.3-4
dogtag-pki-server-theme - 11.0.3-4
pki-base - 11.0.3-4
pki-base-java - 11.0.3-4
pki-ca - 11.0.3-4
pki-console - 11.0.3-4
pki-javadoc - 11.0.3-4
pki-kra - 11.0.3-4
pki-ocsp - 11.0.3-4
pki-server - 11.0.3-4
pki-tks - 11.0.3-4
pki-tools - 11.0.3-4
pki-tps - 11.0.3-4
python3-pki-base - 11.0.3-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dogtag-pki package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '11.0.3-4').
